main event: A bright, pulsating object larger than a star was observed in the sky over South Portland, Maine, on 4 August 1956.
interesting points: The object was seen moving northeast before turning south slowly., The sighting lasted approximately 15 minutes., The object was visually observed and seen through binoculars., The report suggests that previous similar activities were reported in the same area within the past 36 hours., The most probable explanation for the object is that it was a bright star, planet, or meteor.
witness description: observation made from the Coast Guard Station
